.. role:: code

.. highlight:: lean

.. _symbols:

Symbols
--------

The list below shows what to type (e.g., in the vscode IDE with lean extension) to produce some of the special characters used in the `lean-ualib`_.

.. glossary::

    { }
      Surrounds implicit argument(s) and directs parser to use *agressive* type inference; see the :ref:`appendix section on implicit arguments <implicit-arguments>`.

    ‚¶É ‚¶Ñ
      (Type with ``\{{``.) Surrounds implicit argument(s) and directs parser to use *conservative* type inference; see the :ref:`appendix section on implicit arguments <implicit-arguments>`.

    ùî∏
      ``\A`` (or ``\BbbA``)

    ùîπ 
      ``\BbbB``

    ‚ÑÇ
      ``\C`` (or ``\BbbC``)

    ‚Ñï
      ``\N`` (or ``\nat`` or ``\BbbN``)
      
    ùïã 
      ``\BbbT``
      
    ‚Ñ§
      ``\Z`` (or ``\Int`` or ``\BbbZ``)

    L
      ``\mscrL``

    h‚ÇÅ
      ``h\1`` (or ``h\_1``)
      
    h‚ÇÇ
      ``h\2``, etc.

    f‚Çó
      ``f\_l``
  
    fÃÉ
      ``f\tilde``

    RÃÉ
      ``R\tilde``

    fÃÇ
      ``f\hat``                          

    √•
      ``\aa``
  
    ƒõ
      ``\ve``
    
    √∂
      ``\"o``
      
    √ß
      ``\cc``

    Œ±
      ``\a`` (or ``\alpha``)
      
    Œ≤
      ``\b``
      
    Œ≥
      ``\g``

    Œì 
      ``\G``

    Œ¥
      ``\de`` (or ``\delta``)

    Œî 
      ``\D`` (or ``\Delta``)

    Œµ
      ``\e`` (or ``\epsilon``)

    Œπ
      ``\iota``

    Œª
      ``\lamda`` (or ``\Gl`` or ``\la`` or ``\fun``)
      
    Œõ
      ``\L`` (or ``\GL`` or ``\Lambda``)

    œÅ
      ``\rho``

    œÉ
      ``\s`` (or ``\sigma``)
      
    Œ£
      ``\S`` (or ``\Sigma``)
      
    ‚àë
      ``\sum``

    ‚àè
      ``\prod``

    Œ†
      ``\p`` (or ``\Pi``)

    œÄ
      ``\pi``
       
    œï
      ``\phi``

    Œ¶
      ``\Phi``

    √¶
      ``\ae``

    √Ü
      ``\AE``

    ≈ì
      ``\oe``
    
    ≈í
      ``\OE``

    ‚à©
      ``\i``  (or ``\cap`` or ``\intersection``)
  
    ‚ãÇ
      ``\I`` (or ``\bigcap`` or ``\Intersection``)
  
    ‚à™
      ``\un`` (or ``cup`` or ``\union``)
  
    ‚ãÉ
      ``\Un`` (or ``\bigcup`` or ``\Union``)

    ‚àß
      ``\an`` (or ``\and`` or ``\wedge``)

    ‚ãÄ
      ``\And`` (or ``\bigwedge``)

    ‚à®
      ``\vee`` (or ``\or``)

    ‚ãÅ
      ``\Or`` (or ``\bigvee``)

    ¬¨
      ``\n`` (or ``\neg``)

    ‚àò
      ``\o`` (or ``\circ``)

    ‚äö
      ``\oo``

    √ó
      ``\x`` (or ``\times``)

    ‚àÉ
      ``\ex`` (or ``\exists``)

    ‚àÄ
      ``\al`` (or ``\all`` or ``\forall``)

    ‚àà
      ``\in``

    ‚àã
      ``\ni``

    ‚àâ
      ``\inn``, ``\nin`` (or ``\notin``, ``\nni``)

    ‚â§
      ``\leq``

    ‚â•
      ``\geq``                               

    ‚äÜ
      ``\ss`` (or ``\subseteq``)

    ‚äá
      ``\supseteq``        

    ‚äÇ
      ``\subset``

    ‚äÉ
      ``\supset``                         

    ‚â™
      ``\ll``

    ‚â´
      ``\gg``                                 

    ‚ãÜ
      ``\star``

    ‚àó
      ``\ast``                              

    ‚âà
      ``\~~`` (or ``\approx``)

    ‚àº
      ``\sim``               

    ‚â°
      ``\equiv``

    ‚âÖ
      ``\cong``                            

    ‚ü®
      ``\<`` (or ``\langle``)


    ‚ü©
      ``\>`` (or ``\rangle``)     

    ‚Äπ
      ``\f<`` (or ``\f``)

    ‚Ä∫
      ``\f>`` (or ``\fr``)            

    ‚óÄ
      ``\T``

    ‚ñ∏
      ``\t``                                   

    ‚Üê
      ``\l`` (or ``->``)

    ‚Üí
      ``\to`` (or ``\r``)            

    ‚ü∂
      ``\hom`` (or ``-->``)                            

    ‚Üë
      ``\u``

    ‚Üì
      ``\d``                                   

    ‚üπ
      ``==>`` (or ``\nattrans``)                       

    ‚ü∫
      ``\iff``                                         

    ‚Ü¶
      ``\mapsto`` (or ``\r-``)                        |

    ‚Ü†
      ``\rr`` or ``\twoheadrightarrow``                

    ‚Ü£
      ``\pr`` or ``\r->``                              

    ‚àÖ
      ``\emp`` (or ``\empty`` or ``\emptyset``)        

    ‚ä¢
      ``\vdash``

    ‚ä®
      ``\vDash``

    ‚´¢
      ``\vDdash``

    ‚äß
      ``\models``              

    ‚ãà
      ``\j`` (or ``\bowtie``)
